alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:10PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bonner, northwestern Kootenai, northeastern Spokane and southeastern Pend Oreille Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 510 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newport, or 7 miles southwest of Priest River, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport, Spirit Lake, Oldtown, Diamond Lake, and Blanchard. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 325 and 334. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
